meanings.definition: A type of tree native to New Zealand.
meanings.sent1: The miro tree has bright red berries.
meanings.sent2: I saw a beautiful miro tree in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The birds love to perch on the branches of the miro tree.
meanings.sent4: The miro tree stood tall like a guardian of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The miro tree's leaves rustled in the gentle breeze.

meanings.sent1: She gave him a quick miro before turning away.
meanings.sent2: His miro showed his surprise at the unexpected news.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curious miro at the fishbowl made us all laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her miro was like a silent question hanging in the air.
meanings.sent5: His miro held a mix of confusion and interest.

meanings.sent1: Mr. Garcia Miro is a well-known architect.
meanings.sent2: I met Maria Miro at the conference last week.
meanings.sent3: The Miro family reunion was a joyous occasion.
meanings.sent4: The name Miro has a musical ring to it.
meanings.sent5: The Miro surname has a long history in Spain.
